data.title: Where is ‘Passions’ star known as Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald now?
data.meta_description: Where is actress Lindsay Hartley, who played Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald in NBC's soap opera ‘Passions’ in the early 2000s now?
data.text:
American actress Lindsay Hartley became a global sensation after starring in NBC’s soap opera Passions in the early 2000s. Where is she now?

A RUN DOWN MEMORY LANE WITH ‘PASSIONS’ STAR THERESA LOPEZ-FITZGERALD

Many South Africans tuned in every weekday at 16:45 on eTV to catch up on the latest drama with the love triangle between Theresa Lopez-Fitzgerald, Ethen Winthrop, and Gwendolyn Fredericka ‘Gwen’ Hotchkiss which took place in the small town called Harmony.

Lindsay Hartley played the character of Theresa to the T and starred alongside other cast members including Juliet Milis who played Tabitha Lenox, Josh Ryan Evans who played Timmy the talking doll, Brook Kerr who played Whitney Russell – Theresa’s best friend, Galen Gering who played Luis Lopez – Theresa’s on-screen big brother, and several other members of the cast.

The NBC production was produced by Lisa de Cazotte and aired for nine seasons from 1999 to 2008. In the overall production, Hartley appeared in 1262 episodes, IMDb reported.

ALSO READ: Where is the former ‘Backstage’ actor Ziggy now? [photos]

WHERE IS ACTRESS LINDSAY HARTLEY NOW?

After the show ended 15 years ago, Lindsay Hartley’s career did not end there. According to Mamamia, she has since worked on Days of Our Lives to All My Children and then moved on to be part of the General Hospital production.

She is a divorcee and was married to Justin Scott Hartley an American actor who played Fox Crane in Passions. Their marriage lasted from 2004 to 2012. Hartley has a 19-year-old daughter, Isabella Justice Hartley who was born on 3 July 2004. The stunning young lady recently celebrated her birthday in Hawaii.

ALSO READ: Where is the former ‘Backstage’ actor Leroy Gopal now? [photos]

“Happy 19th Birthday Isabella❤️🎊🦄🦋🎂 You are truly my blessing and my best friend. I’m so grateful for our relationship. I’m so proud of you. I love you. To many many more fantastic years of learning, loving, and living🌹🥰😌,” Hartley captioned as she wished her daughter a happy birthday on her feed.

The seasoned actress also recently announced that she is dealing with the tragedy of losing her mother.

“You will be missed Mom. As painful as they have been, I’m grateful we had these past few years to bring us closer together than we have ever been. I’ll miss holding hands. See you when I see you. I love you,” she said in a heartbreaking social media post.
